original: Berg, Ingvar Otskar Daniel’, överste, Såtenäs, f. 10/10/05 i Sthlm av majoren Rudolf B. o. Ingrid Wes-termark. G. 33 m. Uiia Frydén. Barn: Ingrid f. 38, Miagnus 40, Eva 44. — Stud:ex. i Karlstad 24, off :ex. 26, AIHS ak o. hk 28-32, spec:stud. v. KTH 33-35. Stud:res. t. Engl. 39. Fänr. i Svea art:reg. 26, undilöjtn. 28, löjtn. 31, iöjtn. v. flygv. 36, kapten 37, major 42, öv:löjtn. 44, överste 47, chef f. fdygv. bomb- o. iskjutsk. 43, ffottilj-chef v. flygv. o. chef f. Skarab. flygflott. 45. Lär. v. AIHS 38-41, v. flyg-krigshögsk. 43-44. Sakk. i komm. f. flygmed. forskn. 44-45. RSO, RVO-Ikl.
translated: Berg, Ingvar Otskar Daniel, Colonel, Såtenäs, born October 10th, 1905 in Stockholm to Major Rudolf B. and Ingrid Westermark. Married in 1933 to Uiia Frydén. Children: Ingrid born in 1938, Magnus born in 1940, and Eva born in 1944. He completed his high school education in Karlstad in 1924, completed officer's training in 1926, and studied at the AIHS academy and military college from 1928-1932. He completed specialized studies at KTH from 1933-1935 and studied abroad in England in 1939. He joined the Swedish army as a Second Lieutenant in the Svea artillery regiment in 1926, became a First Lieutenant in 1931, became a Flight Lieutenant in 1936, was promoted to Captain in 1937, became a Major in 1942, became a Lieutenant Colonel in 1944, and promoted to Colonel in 1947. He was the commander of the Air Force's bomb and missile squadron in 1943 and was the artillery chief of the Air Force and commander of the Skaraborg Air Fleet in 1945. He was a teacher at AIHS from 1938-1941 and at the Air Force War College from 1943-1944. He was a consultant for the aviation medicine research committee from 1944-1945 and received the RSO and RVO-Ikl. decorations.

worksFor.name: Air Force's Bomb and Missile Squadron
